item.title: Report E-2023090223
item.description:
Report E-2023090223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08-31-23 at 1321 a FRA Inspector in the CSXT Edgewood Yard discovered UTLX645049, a loaded tank car of Crude Sulfate Terpentine leaking vapors from manway. The car was isolated and Georgia-Pacific LLC was notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023083100164). Hepaco LLC, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapors were being released from the manway. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper contact Tom Davidson and 404-376-9550. Contractor personnel opened manway and found that gasket was damaged, Hepaco installed a new manway gasket and tool tightened manway safety bolts. The leak was secured and the car released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move.

DescribePack: A bottle cap was loose, a small amount of liquid leaked from bottle, liquid leaked onto package and made a hole in that area. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a double lined hazmat bin

item.title: Report X-2023081626
item.description:
Report X-2023081626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found box leaking on delivery truck and placed inside several plastic bags to bring back to the station for inspection. DescribePack: 4 1gal bottles of HypoCleanse Isopropyl Alcohol 99% Tech Grade in box with no Hazmat or Limited Quantity markings. Bottles separated into 2 each on either side of a single cardboard divider. Cap on 1 bottle was misaligned and spilled 80% of the liquid into the box. SDS says Class 3 PG II but box only had printed directional arrows and no Hazmat service. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed box inside several plastic bags and gave to QA for inspection when he returned to the station

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Formical-4 fixative decalcifier are crushed and leaked from loose caps. Only slotted partitions were used as inner packing materials. The bottles have a seal but the caps were not secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin, upon arrival, for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report E-2023081030
item.description:
Report E-2023081030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023, at 0909 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Miami, Florida regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons combined of Tremco PUMA BC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), Tremco PUMA TC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), VULKEM® 171 Primer (UN1133, Adhesive, 3, II) from (an unknown amount of) 6-gallon metal drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of the asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) roll-off by contractors which was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060386
item.description:
Report E-2023060386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-06
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 06, 2023, at 0150ET, Circle K reported 9,000-gallons of gasoline released from a 9,003-gallon tanker trailer impacting the asphalt roadway, soil, gravel and a nearby storm drain due to being involved in a multi-vehicle accident. No waterways were impacted. A utility pole was also impacted. The tanker was rear-ended causing the saddle tanks to release the product, as a result the tanker caught fire. The driver reportedly passed away and the roadway was closed. The fire department put out the fire with foam. On May 06, 2023, at 0720 ET, HEPACO arrived onsite to clean up the remaining impact and debris. HEPACO replaced the damaged power pole and flushed the impacted drain with 800-gallons of water. The soil area was excavated and boom was deployed at the drain. HEPACO collected and containerized 1,700 gallons of liquid into a vacuum truck and (2) 55-gallons metal drums of gasoline impacted rags.
